title: Creating a reading list on dataset construction and methodological issues involves selecting articles that cover a range of topics, including data collection, annotation, bias, and validation. Hereâ€™s a list of 20 articles up to 2020 that you might find useful
**"ImageNet Large Scale Visual Recognition Challenge"** by Olga Russakovsky et al
- Discusses the construction of the ImageNet dataset and its impact on computer vision
**"Datasheets for Datasets"** by Timnit Gebru et al
- Proposes a framework for documenting datasets to improve transparency and accountability
- Explores the importance of large datasets in machine learning
**"A Critical Review of Recurrent Neural Networks for Sequence Learning"** by Zachary C
- Discusses methodological issues in sequence learning datasets
**"Gender Shades: Intersectional Accuracy Disparities in Commercial Gender Classification"** by Joy Buolamwini and Timnit Gebru
- Examines bias in facial recognition datasets
**"The PASCAL Visual Object Classes (VOC) Challenge"** by Mark Everingham et al
- Details the creation and challenges of the VOC dataset for object detection
**"Crowdsourcing and the Semantic Web: A Research Manifesto"** by Abraham Bernstein et al
- Discusses the use of crowdsourcing in dataset annotation and its challenges
**"The Role of Data in AI's Recent Progress: How Data and the Data Pipeline Influence AI"** by Matei Zaharia et al
- Analyzes the impact of data quality and pipeline on AI development
**"Datasets for Natural Language Processing"** by Chris Callison-Burch and Mark Dredze
- Reviews various NLP datasets and their construction issues
**"The Open Images Dataset V4: Unified Image Classification, Object Detection, and Visual Relationship Detection at Scale"** by Alina Kuznetsova et al
- Discusses the challenges in creating a large-scale image dataset
**"Bias in Bios: A Case Study of Semantic Representation Bias in a High-Stakes Setting"** by Aylin Caliskan et al
note: - Investigates bias in datasets used for semantic representation.

title: **"The Ethics of Using Machine Learning in Medicine"** by Irene Y
- Discusses ethical considerations in medical datasets
**"The Case for Learned Index Structures"** by Tim Kraska et al
- Explores the use of machine learning in database indexing and its implications for dataset construction
**"The Stanford Question Answering Dataset"** by Pranav Rajpurkar et al
- Details the creation of a dataset for machine reading comprehension
**"A Survey on Bias and Fairness in Machine Learning"** by Mehrnoosh Sameki et al
- Reviews bias issues in datasets and their impact on machine learning models
- A classic paper on the creation and use of the MNIST dataset
**"The Role of Data in AI's Recent Progress: How Data and the Data Pipeline Influence AI"** by Matei Zaharia et al
- Analyzes the impact of data quality and pipeline on AI development
**"The Open Images Dataset V4: Unified Image Classification, Object Detection, and Visual Relationship Detection at Scale"** by Alina Kuznetsova et al
- Discusses the challenges in creating a large-scale image dataset
**"Bias in Bios: A Case Study of Semantic Representation Bias in a High-Stakes Setting"** by Aylin Caliskan et al
note: - Investigates bias in datasets used for semantic representation.

title: **"The Ethics of Using Machine Learning in Medicine"** by Irene Y
- Discusses ethical considerations in medical datasets
These articles cover a broad spectrum of issues related to dataset construction, including ethical considerations, bias, and the technical challenges of creating large-scale datasets
